磨.definition: grindstone; to grind; to turn round

磨人.definition: annoying; bothersome; to fret; to be peevish

磨刀不誤砍柴工.pinyin: mo2 dao1 bu4 wu4 kan3 chai2 gong1
磨刀不誤砍柴工.definition: lit. sharpening the axe won't make the wood-splitting take longer (idiom); fig. time invested in preparations is not lost; a beard well lathered is half shaved

磨刀霍霍.definition: lit. to sharpen one's sword (idiom); fig. to prepare to attack; to be getting ready for battle

磨合.definition: to break in; to wear in

磨唧.definition: (dialect) to be very slow; to dawdle

磨嘰.definition: (dialect) to dawdle; to waste time; also written 墨跡|墨迹[mo4 ji5]

磨嘴.definition: to argue pointlessly; to talk incessant nonsense; to blather

磨嘴皮子.definition: to wear out the skin of one's teeth (idiom); pointlessly blather; to talk incessant nonsense; blah blah

磨得開.definition: to feel unembarrassed; to be at ease; (dialect) to be convinced; to come round

磨拳擦掌.definition: variant of 摩拳擦掌[mo1 quan2 ca1 zhang3]

磨損.definition: to suffer wear and tear; to deteriorate through use; to wear out

磨杵成針.definition: to grind an iron bar down to a fine needle (idiom); fig. to persevere in a difficult task; to study diligently

磨煩.definition: to pester; to bother sb incessantly; to delay; to prevaricate

磨牙.definition: to grind one's teeth (during sleep); pointless arguing; (coll.) molar

磨盤.definition: lower millstone; tray of a mill

磨砂.definition: to scrub with an abrasive; to sand; frosted (e.g. glass)

磨破嘴皮.definition: to talk until one is blue in the face

磨破嘴皮子.definition: to wear out one's lips (idiom); to talk until one is blue in the face; to repeat again and again

磨礪.definition: to sharpen on grindstone; to improve oneself by practice

磨穿鐵硯.definition: to grind one's way through an ink stone; to persevere in a difficult task (idiom); to study diligently (idiom)

磨練.definition: to temper oneself; to steel oneself; self-discipline; endurance

磨耗.definition: wear and tear; wearing out by friction

磨豆腐.definition: to grumble; to chatter away incessantly

磨蹭.definition: to rub lightly; to move slowly; to dawdle; to dillydally; to pester; to nag

磨難.definition: a torment; a trial; tribulation; a cross (to bear); well-tried
